732034f-a.title: Islands - Governors Island.
732034f-a.text:
A panoramic view of qovernor's Island, as seen from the south of Brook-
lyn. Bedloe's Island is also seen in the center background.
About 1860.7

732035f-a.title: Islands - Governors Island - [Upper New York Bay.]
732035f-a.text:
Governor's Island (center background) in the Upper New York Bay, as
viewed southward on the East River from Brooklyn Bridge. On the right
appear piers at the tip of Manhattan.
About 1886.
J. Koehler.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

732065f-a.title: Islands - Governors Island - Fort Jay.
732065f-a.text:
The grim battlements of Fort Jay (built in 1812), upon Governor's Is.
land, stand ready to defend New York Bay and the metropolitan area. Man-
hattan's southern tip is to the north.
1925.
wurts Brothera.

732050f-c.title: Islands - Governors Island - [Upper New York Bay - New York Dock Co.; Standish Arms Hotel.]
732050f-c.text:
00overnors Island: A set of 3 views photographed
from aiop the Hotel St. George in Brooklyn showing
Butter-milk Channel separatung the above mentioned Island
from the Brooklyn mainland. Gene:ally speaking this is
more or less included in the Upper New York Bay.
Note beyond the Statue of Liuerty on Bedloes Island,
wwd the Bayonne, New Je sey shoreline. The photographer
is viewing eastward and has eliminated lower lanhattan,
which if shown would be on the right.
Views 1-2: June 15, 1933
View 3: August 24,1938
P. L. Sperr
NO REPPODUCTIONS
